page.title: 02Housing Industry Weather
page.content: Holme and Holmebridge villages are located in the lower lying eastern area, some kilometers apart. Holme is composed of traditional millstone grit cottages in which the domestic woollen trade was once carried on and is now a conservation area. Holmebridge is larger and developed with Industrial woollen trade and mills were in production until recently. Five reservoirs adjacent to the villages are bordered by plantations of conifers, the largest belonging to the Forestry Commision. Parking and picknic areas have been provided for visitors. The two main roads that rise from the Holme Valley to cross the Pennines have steep gradients and rain, mist and snow present problems for travellers in the winter. Snow lies for long periods and ice or drifting snow closes these roads.
